hypothesis: (Our misconduct was overlooked because we played a part in the arrest.)

hypothesis: Jane's a trouble maker to us, you can help clean it up.

source: - 一息入れろよ、マイク
references: ['- Get some ice cream, Mike.']

hypothesis: All day today, I have been observing every single word of these 23 former suspects, from their every move to their unconscious reactions.

hypothesis: For you who just got back to work, it can be emotionally unstable and I'm watching your every move to those above you.

hypothesis: people raising and lowering there

hypothesis: It is also true that, with his outstanding technology, he has developed techniques that the medical community hesitates to do, and has saved lives that could not be saved.”

source: にわか仕込みの信心で わしの後釜に座る気か？
references: ['Does he seek to humble me with his new found piety?']
hypothesis: Do you want to sit in my successor with your sudden faith?

source: 俺はお前の後釜に座って さらにハッピーさ
references: ["And I'll be more than happy to fill your shoes."]
hypothesis: I'm even happier sitting after you

source: 私を今の地位から追い出して 自分が後釜に座ろうと 画策しているのよ
references: ["You're trying to drive me from my position, so you can take over."]
hypothesis: They're plotting to kick me out of my current position and take over for myself.

source: 服従心の事？
references: ['About their obedience?']
hypothesis: Obedience?

source: 得体が知れないわ
references: ["We don't even know what that is."]
hypothesis: I don't know

source: だが, 得心が行かぬ.
references: ['But something bothers me...']
hypothesis: However, I am not convinced.

source: 彼らは すべてを殺す・・・ 慈悲や後悔は微塵も無い
references: ["They'll kill everything... without mercy or remorse."]
hypothesis: They kill everything... not a shred of mercy or remorse

source: 心が乱れてるんだ
references: ["He's got a lot on his mind."]
hypothesis: I'm confused

source: ワシの申し出に心が動いておる
references: ["That's why I put a special wimp clause in my will."]
hypothesis: My heart is moved by my offer

source: チャーリーは あの馬鹿なカードを受け取ってから 心が洗われたようだった 彼女は　セラピーに来て
references: ['Charlie had this, this... moment of clarity... after she got that stupid card.']
hypothesis: Charlie seemed soothed after receiving that silly card She came to therapy

source: 最高のオモチャを見つけて 久しぶりに心が躍りました
references: ['I had found the perfect plaything. My heart danced with joy for the first time in a long time.']
hypothesis: I found the best toy, and my heart danced for the first time in a long time

source: ♪ 心が躍るの
references: ["There 'll be magic There 'll be fun"]
hypothesis: ♪ My heart flutters

source: ゾーンと心が 通いあう人間ですから
references: ['You see, being a stalker is some sort of calling.']
hypothesis: Because he is a person who communicates with the zone

source: 心が通い合えば　治療に役立つ。
references: ["If you can connect with each other, it's easier to treat them."]
hypothesis: If we communicate with each other, it will be helpful for treatment.

source: 何週間、何ヶ月離れていても 地球の裏側にいても 心が通っていました
references: ['The weeks away lengthened to months, but every day would bring his thoughts from some distant part.']
hypothesis: Even if we were separated for weeks or months, even if we were on the other side of the world, our hearts connected.

source: 訓練生仲間とは 心が通じあってると思っていた
references: ['These people were my friends... or at least I thought they were.']
hypothesis: I thought my fellow trainees were on good terms with each other.

source: そして目を合わせるだけで 心が通じ合う気がします
references: ['And I feel I can communicate with you with simply a look.']
hypothesis: And just by making eye contact, I feel like our hearts are connected

source: 俺が言いたいのは 心に刻んでくれ 仕事には ケガが付きまとう
references: ['So the upside of this... it is a stark reminder injuries do not get swept under the rug on this job.']
hypothesis: What I'm trying to say is take it to heart, work is about injuries.

source: ルーディがロボットを 解体しているのを見てたら- ふと こう思ったんです 誰が僕のことを心に 刻んでくれるんだろう ってね
references: ["Just looking at that bot on Rudy's table makes me think, who is going to remember me?"]
hypothesis: When I saw Rudy dismantling robots, I thought to myself, "Who's going to remember me?"

source: メイザー･ラッカムの勇気を 君らの心に刻んで欲しい
references: ['Let the courage of Mazer Rackham be your inspiration.']
hypothesis: Engrave in your hearts the courage of Mather Rackham.

source: パキスタンの音楽は 一生心に残るらしいね
references: ["I've heard enough Pakistani music to last a lifetime, if you don't mind."]
hypothesis: Pakistani music will stay in your heart for the rest of your life.

source: ジョンの面白い話を知っているか？ （本： 心に残る結婚式のスピーチ）
references: ['Do you know any funny stories about John?']
hypothesis: Do you know John's funny story? (Book: Memorable Wedding Speeches)

source: どうしよう 心に残りすぎ
references: ["She's on my mind."]
hypothesis: What should I do? Too much remains in my heart

source: 初めに心に浮かんだ言葉です
references: ["It's the word that came to mind."]
hypothesis: The first words that came to mind

source: 人が観察できるのは 既に心に浮かんでいるものだけだ。
references: ['One observes only things which are already on the mind.']
hypothesis: One can only observe what is already in the mind.

source: 二つのことが心に浮かぶって言ったでしょ
references: ['You said two things occur to you.']
hypothesis: You said two things come to mind

source: -犠牲を心に留め -我々がそうすることを望むだろう
references: ['Be mindful... it may well be hoping we do this.']
hypothesis: - mind the sacrifices - we would like to

source: 彼女の警告を 心に留めて
references: ["Keep her warning' with you, nail it to your memory."]
hypothesis: heed her warning

source: 女神に触るな 彼女の言葉を心に留めよ
references: ['Touch not the noble one. Heed her words!']
hypothesis: don't touch the goddess take her word for it

source: 心を乱していた 内陸でさえも..."
references: ['"and deranged the public mind, even far inland, it must be said that professional seamen were especially alarmed."']
hypothesis: Even the inland was disturbing..."

source: 夜は心を乱すものです
references: ['Night changes many thoughts.']
hypothesis: the night is disturbing

source: トレントは、僕らの関係に妬いてて、 彼女の心を乱そうとしてる。
references: ["Trent Preston is gonna mindfuck her into thinking she's too good for me."]
hypothesis: Trent is jealous of our relationship and trying to upset her.

source: 心を入れ替えたと 会いたいと 付け加えろ
references: ["Tell him you've changed your mind and you need to see him."]
hypothesis: Add that you've changed your mind and want to meet

source: 心を入れ替えるよ
references: ["I'll do better."]
hypothesis: I'll change my mind

source: 古風な恋愛が とても人の心を動かすんだね〜
references: ["I find old-fashioned romance so touching, don't you?"]
hypothesis: Old-fashioned love moves people's hearts

source: 人の心を動かす
references: ['It is a human calculation.']
hypothesis: move people's hearts

source: マペットたちと一緒の この場所にある カーミットの心を 動かしたのは君だ
references: ["Hey, you're the one who got Kermit to do this."]
hypothesis: You're the one who touched Kermit's heart in this place with the Muppets.

source: 私はずっと君に 関心を寄せていた キエラやリバー８がやって来て
references: ['Alec, I have always had an abiding interest in you, and when Liber8 and Kiera arrived in this time']
hypothesis: I've always had an interest in you. Kiera and River 8 came along.

source: ［私たち聖職者はみな　まず何よりも］ ［ラティマー家の方々に心を寄せています］
references: ["'Well, first and foremost, all of our prayers are with the Latimer family."]
hypothesis: [We priests are first and foremost] [Our hearts go out to the Latimers]

source: 艦内生活体験プログラムに 皆様が大きな関心を寄せて下さって
references: ['People are so excited about the live-aboard program.']
hypothesis: Thank you for showing great interest in our onboard life experience program.

source: それを見たときに 何かが心を打ったのでしょう
references: ['Just sort of hit her in some personal way when she saw the play.']
hypothesis: Something struck me when I saw it

source: それでいて 心を打つ物は
references: ['And still, where it strikes me...']
hypothesis: Yet what touches my heart

source: 貴女には人間性が無い 貴女の心を打つものが無い
references: ['Nothing human would ever enter your mind.']
hypothesis: You have no humanity Nothing touches you

source: これ以上良心を痛めたくない
references: ["I don't want any more on my conscience."]
hypothesis: I don't want to hurt my conscience any more

source: エミリ ダグのことでまだ心を痛めているのは わかるし・・・ ディエゴのこともあったから 混乱するのはわかるさ
references: ["Emily, you're grieving for Doug and you're still confused about what Diego did."]
hypothesis: I know you're still upset about Emily Doug... and I know you're confused because of Diego.

source: 君があの患者を亡くした時 どんなに心を痛めたかは　知ってる でも　今その仕事を懺悔のつもりで しているなら・・・
references: ["I know how much it hurt when you lost that patient, but if you're doing all this as some kind of penance..."]
hypothesis: I know how much it hurt you when you lost that patient, but if you're doing this job with the intention of repentance...

source: 心を砕くのは個人的
references: ['Crushed hearts are personal.']
hypothesis: Breaking hearts is personal

source: 心を許したからだ
references: ["'Cause you gave it up to me."]
hypothesis: because I forgave my heart

source: ヴェイルの美しさは豪家の気品にのみ、 その心を許すのです
references: ['The beauty of the Vale is matched only by the nobility of its great families.']
hypothesis: The beauty of the Vale allows only the dignity of a wealthy family.

source: 家族とは互いに心を配るということだ
references: ['And family means we take care of each other.']
hypothesis: Family means taking care of each other

source: ウィルに心を配って
references: ['Take care of Will.']
hypothesis: take care of will

source: お言葉ですが、私たちのコレクションです 私が心血を注いで 10年以上かけて集めたんです その労力を思えば...
references: ["No, you know what I think I'm actually entitled to say Our collection, considering the time that I've put in over 10 years curating that."]
hypothesis: It's our collection.

source: 世界を正そうと 心血を注いでるじゃない
references: ["I've watched you. Working with the Fringe Division, you've done everything in your power to heal the damage."]
hypothesis: You're pouring your heart and soul into fixing the world, aren't you?

source: 別に ちょっと念を押しただけです
references: ['Nothing. Just clearing something up.']
hypothesis: just a little reminder

source: ワグナー将軍に町の秩序を回復することを 最優先するように念を押すように
references: ['Make sure general wagner understands our priority is to maintain order in the streets.']
hypothesis: Remind General Wagner to prioritize restoring order in the town.

source: 何を念頭に置いていますか？
references: ['What have you in mind?']
hypothesis: what do you have in mind?

source: 私たちはすべて自分自身に保ちます。 私はそれを念頭に置いています 決して捕らえられません。
references: ['And I try to keep that in mind and never get caught short.']
hypothesis: we all keep to ourselves. I have it in mind Never caught.

source: 私は より協力的なものを 念頭に置いている
references: ['I have something more collaborative in mind.']
hypothesis: I have something more cooperative in mind

source: ご主人様のお怒りを買って 分解されてから... 通訳がいなくて困ってたのよ
references: ['We have been without an interpreter... since our master got angry with our last protocol droid... and disintegrated him.']
hypothesis: After getting my master's wrath taken apart... I've been in trouble because I don't have an interpreter.

source: こうして お姫様を連れ去ろうとした ２人の悪い魔女たちは― 王の怒りを買うと―
references: ["'And so the two bad witches who tried to take the princess away... 'invited the king's wrath."]
hypothesis: The two wicked witches who tried to kidnap the princess in this way--the king's wrath--

source: 放置しておくと FBIの 怒りを買う それにあなたを信じている人が 軽蔑されるわ
references: ["You leave it up, and you're just waving a red flag in front of the FBI and thumbing your nose at all the people who believed in you."]
hypothesis: If you leave it alone, you'll provoke the FBI's wrath, and people who believe in you will look down on you.

source: 悲しいときは去り 思いも寄らない幸運が来る
references: ['And I predict all the sad and dark times are over and you are going to be beyond happy.']
hypothesis: When sadness goes away, unexpected luck comes

source: 思いも寄らない　ダンさんは ウイザートン保険の為に働いた 6年間... 定職について
references: ['Unlikely, Mr. Dang has worked for Witherton Insurance for six years... a steady job, no drug or alcohol problems, not so much as a speeding ticket.']
hypothesis: Unsuspecting Mr. Dan worked for Witherton Insurance for six years... About a regular job

source: そんな事 思いも寄らなかった
references: ["I didn't know you couldn't do that. I dealt with the various animal rights groups,"]
hypothesis: I never thought of that

source: 私は別の男性に 思いを寄せていますが 理由は判らず 納得もしていません 何かが狂った様に 私を突き動かしていて...
references: ["I am having feelings for another man, and I don't know why, and I gotta admit, it's kind of starting to drive me a little bit crazy, and..."]
hypothesis: I have a crush on another man, but I don't know why, and I don't understand it, and something is driving me crazy...

source: けど、あなたは以前の人生にしがみついている。 思いを寄せる人にしがみついている、 それこそ地獄よ。
references: ["But trying to hold on to this life, clinging to the person you thought you could be, that's hell."]
hypothesis: But you are clinging to your previous life. It's hell, clinging to someone you care about.

source: 寄付金に思いを馳せると
references: ['Think of the donations.']
hypothesis: Thinking about donations

source: 聴取しようと思ってたが "人類 の危機に思いを馳せる" とか言ってた
references: ['Oh, I tried to talk to him, but he said he needed a minute to "muse upon the fragile nature of human life."']
hypothesis: I was going to ask, but he said something like "think about the crisis of humanity"

source: 未来に思いを馳せ 旅を続けてたんだろう
references: ['And may fortune... guide her journey.']
hypothesis: Thinking about the future, I guess I continued my journey

source: 魔術師の思う壺です
references: ["That's what the warlock wants."]
hypothesis: It's a magician's pot

source: まさに奴はこれを望んでた　我々２人が ポータルに向かえば あいつの思う壺だ
references: ['This is precisely what he wants. Us together heading for the portal.']
hypothesis: This is exactly what he wanted, if we both headed for the portal, it's what he thinks.

source: それこそサイロンの思う壺じゃない お互いに向き合わせたいのよ
references: ["That's exactly what the Cylons want. For us to turn on each other."]
hypothesis: That's not what the Cylons want, we want to face each other

source: 急いては事を仕損じる
references: ['Haste makes waste.']
hypothesis: Rushing is a waste of time

source: 急いては 事を仕損じるぞ
references: ["And you can't just rush into danger, either."]
hypothesis: Hurry up and you'll lose your job

source: 妹も武器が要るそうだ 個性に合うやつを作ってくれ
references: ['My sister needs a weapon. Something that suits her personality.']
hypothesis: It seems my sister needs a weapon too. Please make one that matches her personality.

source: 隠居生活は性に合わなかったか ゴルフに飽きた？
references: ["Clearly, retirement doesn't suit you. You got tired of shooting golf?"]
hypothesis: Did retirement not suit you? Tired of playing golf?

source: 一度 試したが性に合わない
references: ["On the grounds that I tried it once and I didn't like it."]
hypothesis: I tried it once but it doesn't suit me

source: 性に合わない
references: ["Yeah, it's not my thing."]
hypothesis: unsuitable for sex

source: - 性懲りも無く...
references: ['- Any busybodies']
hypothesis: - No sexual harassment...

source: そして性懲りもなく再度 5年後にこれだ
references: ['And then you did it again five years later.']
hypothesis: And again, without any sexual harassment, 5 years later, this is it

source: "性懲りもなく又寝たのか？ - 黙って聞いてくれ"
references: ['What, did he sleep with her again?']
hypothesis: "Did you go back to sleep without being sexually abusive? - Shut up and listen."

source: 恐れをなしたのか？
references: ['Out of fear?']
hypothesis: did you get scared?

source: これらの少年の中から... 名をあげれば 全軍の兵士が恐れをなす 戦士の中で育った一人...
references: ['From among these boys, one grew into a warrior so fierce that entire armies would retreat in terror with the mention of his name.']
hypothesis: Out of these boys... one who grew up among warriors who feared all armies...

source: 恐れをなして 逃げるとでも思うか
references: ['It seems no one has ever had the privilege of leaving, either.']
hypothesis: Do you think I'll run away in fear

source: 恨みを買って ソイツガ巨人化したらどうする
references: ['What if he gets mad and turns into a Titan?']
hypothesis: What would you do if you bought a grudge and turned Soitsuga into a giant?

source: もしくはただ単に− 彼女が誰かの恨みを買っているかだ たくさん居そうだがな
references: ["Or just inept, but the way Sofia treats people, it's no stretch to believe that someone wants her dead."]
hypothesis: Or just- she's taking someone's grudge, I'm sure there are many.

source: ヴァンパイアの恨みを買う
references: ["The vamps don't take kindly to the juice dispenser."]
hypothesis: buy a vampire's grudge

source: 恩に着ます
references: ['And thank you.']
hypothesis: be indebted

source: すまない ビリー 恩に着る
references: ["Sure. It's nice of you, Billy, thank you."]
hypothesis: sorry billy

source: 『本当にその仕事がもらえたら　ありがたい 恩に着るよ』
references: ['I could really use the work. Thanks, buddy."']
hypothesis: "If you really get that job, I'll be grateful."

source: 恩を仇で返すのか？ 報道生命を賭けるのか！ イギリスが終わるんだぞ！
references: ["You know how much help you're getting hereon in?"]
hypothesis: Will you repay kindness with evil? Are you betting your journalistic life? England is over!

source: 恩を売ろうとしているのかもしれない... 新たな〈金貨の主〉に
references: ["Maybe they're trying to curry some favor with the new Master of Coin."]
hypothesis: Maybe he's trying to sell his favor... to the new Master of Gold Coins.

source: 何をするにも息が切れる
references: ['Doing anything makes breathing difficult']
hypothesis: I'm out of breath no matter what I do

source: - 息が切れてるように聞こえるけど -
references: ['You sound winded.']
hypothesis: - It sounds like you're out of breath -

source: 息が切れる 頼むから飛ばすな
references: ["I'm out of breath! Not so fast, for Christ's sake!"]
hypothesis: I'm out of breath, I'm begging you, don't fly

source: お前達二人は 随分息が合ってるんだな？
references: ["You realize you two are finishing each other's sentences, right?"]
hypothesis: You two are pretty much in sync, aren't you?

source: いい コンビじゃないか 息が合ってる
references: ['You know, for being new partners, you guys are pretty good together.']
hypothesis: It's a good combination, isn't it?

source: お前の部下に 息が掛かってる マローニのな
references: ["Assuming, of course, that they are still your people and not Maroni's."]
hypothesis: Your men are breathing, Maloney.

source: 兜は息が詰まる
references: ['His helmet is stifling.']
hypothesis: the helmet is suffocating

source: 息が詰まるまで 締め上げるからな
references: ['I wrap the scarf around your neck and strangle you. I promise.']
hypothesis: I'll tighten it up until I can't breathe

source: かゆいし 息が詰まります
references: ["It's itching. It's choking me."]
hypothesis: Itchy and suffocating

source: そのランプコードで 彼の息の根を止める
references: ['Just choke him out with that lamp cord, then.']
hypothesis: Stop his life with that lamp cord

source: 胸を刺し 息の根を止めた
references: ['Finished them off with a single stab to the chest.']
hypothesis: I stabbed my chest and stopped the root of my breath

source: - 息の根を止めるぞ
references: ["We'll just have to finish him."]
hypothesis: - I'm going to stop you

source: 王が帰還し 都が息を吹き返し... 滅びを免れるのではないかと...
references: ['That a king will come and this city will be as it once was before it fell into decay.']
hypothesis: The king has returned and the city has come back to life...may it escape its destruction...

source: 息を吹き返してレバンダー！
references: ['Come back, Levander!']
hypothesis: Bring back your breath, Levander!

source: 私は息を吹き返した
references: ['He came and I came... Back to life.']
hypothesis: I caught my breath

source: 息を呑むような女性との出会いは?
references: ['Or saw a woman who literally took your breath away?']
hypothesis: What about meeting a woman who will take your breath away?

source: 彼は息を引き取った シュレッダーの計画を破壊しようとした
references: ["His last breath was taken trying to destroy Shredder's plan."]
hypothesis: He died trying to destroy Shredder's plans.

source: デーヴ・スカイラーク 息を引き取る
references: ['This is Dave Skylark signing off.']
hypothesis: Dave Skylark takes his last breath

source: だから私の友人であり 良き指導者でもあった彼が ベッドで安らかに息を引き取ったと 電話を受けた時
references: ["And that's why, when they called me and told me that my, uh, friend, my mentor had passed away peacefully in his bed,"]
hypothesis: So when I got the call that my friend and mentor passed away peacefully in his bed.

source: 彼等は閣下の子息を殺しました
references: ['These people murdered your son, madam president.']
hypothesis: they killed your son

source: 弟の殺人犯は 息を潜めてる
references: ["My brother's killer. Still breathing."]
hypothesis: My brother's killer is holding his breath.

source: 震えて・・・息を潜めながらは
references: ['Cowering. Clawing for breath']
hypothesis: trembling... while holding my breath

source: こうして父は死んだ あの小さな化け物は 今もどこかで息を潜めている
references: ['And now our father is dead and that little monster is out there somewhere drawing breath.']
hypothesis: That's how my father died That little monster is still hiding somewhere

source: -　ステリオス　息を継げ
references: ['- Stelios, catch your breath, boy.']
hypothesis: - Stelios Hold Your Breath

source: ウィスキーを飲みながら 悦に入ってますが
references: ["You're very comfortable here with your glass of scotch,"]
hypothesis: drinking whiskey

source: - 悪いようにはしない　な？
references: ['- they might go easy on you, okay?']
hypothesis: - Don't be rude, okay?

source: 《言うことを聞いてくれたら 悪いようにはしない》 《だが もし誰かに話すというなら》
references: ["you won't be sorry."]
hypothesis: 《If you listen to me, I won’t do anything wrong》 《But if you want to tell someone》

source: 誰の仕事を手伝ってるのか 名前が知りたい　そうすれば 悪いようにはしない
references: ["Those are the people that we want, so if you give us their names, this won't be so bad."]
hypothesis: I want to know the name of whose work I'm helping, so I won't do bad things.

source: そうだな．．． 悪態をつく必要はない カール
references: ["Well... You don't have to swear, Carl."]
hypothesis: Right. . . No need to curse, Carl.

source: 時々悪態をつくの
references: ['I swear sometimes.']
hypothesis: I curse sometimes

source: 悪態をつくな 話し合いが必要だ
references: ['You really got a bad attitude. We need to talk.']
hypothesis: don't curse, we need a discussion

hypothesis: the dead don't speak

source: それで　デルは 別の毛色の変わった 興行を打った
references: ['So, Dell arranged a different kind of command performance.']
hypothesis: So Dell hit another quirky box office

source: わかるわ そんな女の気が知れない
references: ['I know. What kind of cheap woman could ever do something like that?']
hypothesis: I know, I don't understand women like that

source: デカフェなど飲むヤツの 気が知れない
references: ['What kind of idiot drinks decaf anyway?']
hypothesis: I don't understand people who drink decaf

source: あれで納得する人の気が知れない
references: ["Who'd believe it?"]
hypothesis: I don't know anyone who would agree with that

source: 気が乗っているんでね
references: ["I'm in a generous mood."]
hypothesis: I'm excited

source: 女の子を集めて 来なくちゃ、気が乗らねぇ
references: ['Maybe we should get some girls to watch this stunt, huh?']
hypothesis: Gather the girls, I have to come

source: 何かしら 気が乗ってないのかもしれんよ
references: ['He might not be into getting back together with her.']
hypothesis: Maybe I'm just not in the mood for something

source: 気が乗らなくて...
references: ["Doesn't seem right."]
hypothesis: I don't feel like...

source: 気が乗らないわ, ブライトン
references: ["I'm not in the mood, Brighton."]
hypothesis: I'm reluctant, Brighton

source: 気が乗らなくて
references: ["Wasn't feeling the vibe."]
hypothesis: I'm reluctant

source: 気が付かなかった
references: ['- It was so obvious. - Glucose levels.']
hypothesis: didn't notice

source: 頭を撃ち抜けば 死んだと気が付くのに
references: ["You should've shot her in the head so they could hear her die."]
hypothesis: If you shoot me in the head, I'll know I'm dead

source: 多分　気が付かなかったんだろう しかし　ダンピアではそんな 楽しいサーカスはない、だろ？
references: ["Maybe you haven't noticed, but Dampier's no three-ring bloody circus, is it?"]
hypothesis: You probably didn't realize it, but Dampier doesn't have that kind of fun circus, does it?

source: いくらかの市民に 気が付いたが 私に背を向けている
references: ['I noticed some of your townsfolk turned their backs towards me.']
hypothesis: I've noticed some citizens, but they're turning their backs on me.

source: 気が休まる
references: ['It helps.']
hypothesis: soothing

source: ライブワイヤーが逃走中で あなたを残して帰ったら― 気が休まりませんから
references: ["And I don't really feel comfortable leaving you here alone with Livewire on the loose."]
hypothesis: Livewire is on the run, and if I leave you behind--I won't be able to rest.

source: 気が休まらないだろ？
references: ["And... you're not comfortable with that?"]
hypothesis: Are you restless?

source: これぞ 気が利くってもんだ
references: ["Now, that's what I call making yourself useful, love."]
hypothesis: It's nice of you

source: 本当に　もう 気が利かないんだから。
references: ['Seriously, you are so dense.']
hypothesis: I really don't care anymore.

source: お前はホントに気が利かないんだから 夫人は千歳以上で執念深いのよ
references: ['You are really a clumsy flatterer filled with severe grudge']
hypothesis: Because you really don't care

source: わたしとならきっと気が合う
references: ['And definitely the most fun.']
hypothesis: I'm sure you'll get along with me

source: 昔よ 気が向いたら またやろう
references: ['And I will again, once inspiration strikes.']
hypothesis: A long time ago, if I feel like it, I'll do it again

source: - いつもジンジャーの回りのことは気が咎めるわ...
references: ['I always feel so guilty around Ginger.']
hypothesis: - I always feel bad about things around Ginger...

source: すみません 気が回らなくて
references: ["I know. I'm sorry. I should have said that."]
hypothesis: I'm sorry I'm out of my mind

source: 元カノには気が回らなかった
references: ["There's nothing you can say that changes that."]
hypothesis: I didn't care about my ex-girlfriend

source: 他の人はそこまで気が回らない?
references: ["They couldn't be couriered?"]
hypothesis: Do other people not care that much?

source: アルメニア人は 血の気が多いと言われる
references: ['We are all said to be fiery.']
hypothesis: Armenians are said to be hot-blooded

source: 気が大きくなるから 実際そうでした
references: ['Because it takes courage to think for yourself. She did.']
hypothesis: It really did

source: 親父に嫌気が差して 家出したんだと言われた
references: ['Said she probably ran to escape her jerk of a father.']
hypothesis: My father told me that I ran away from home because I was sick of it

source: ここの奴らに 嫌気が差したのさ
references: ["Because, man, I-- I'm just-- I'm done with this group, man."]
hypothesis: I'm sick of these guys here

source: 逃げることに嫌気が差した
references: ["You're sick of running."]
hypothesis: tired of running away

source: 答えるのに気が引けるが
references: ["Alas, the answer's not so excellent."]
hypothesis: I hesitate to answer

source: さすがに気が引けるけど
references: ['And that was a dick move. Even for me.']
hypothesis: It really bothers me

source: ジェナー博士 うっとおしいのは分かってる 俺も質問を投げかけるのは 気が引ける...
references: ['Dr. Jenner, I know this has been taxing for you and I hate to ask one more question, but...']
hypothesis: Dr. Jenner, I know it's annoying, but I'm too reluctant to ask questions...

source: 独りで歩いて来るなんて 気が強いのも考えものね
references: ['It seems to me to show an abominable sort of conceited independence.']
hypothesis: It's unthinkable that you're strong-willed to come walking alone

source: 女性は皆、気が強い
references: ["I know. It's just, you seem like a strong lady, is all."]
hypothesis: all women are strong

source: ちっこいのは気が強い 持ち上げとけ
references: ['Oh, little people are mean.']
hypothesis: Small things are strong-willed, lift them up

source: あなたは気が散ってた
references: ["You've been distracted."]
hypothesis: you were distracted

source: 気が散らないから 落ち着いて仕事ができる
references: ["You're lucky... no distractions. You have your work and you do it."]
hypothesis: No distractions so I can work calmly

source: 生まれつきすぐに気が散って 病的なほど疑い深い気質だ
references: ['Distractible and paranoid by nature.']
hypothesis: Naturally easily distracted and morbidly suspicious

source: 「気が早いな．．．」
references: ['Can you still?']
hypothesis: "You're quick..."

source: 気が早いな メキシコの祝日か？
references: ['Holy crap. -What, is it Cinco de Mayo already?']
hypothesis: Is it a Mexican holiday?

source: 私が父親と住みたがるんじゃないかと 気が気じゃないみたい
references: ["She's all freaked out that I'm gonna want to live with him or whatever."]
hypothesis: I don't think I want to live with my father.

source: でも 入試がね 気が気じゃないもんね
references: ["With the exams, you're probably not in the mindset."]
hypothesis: But I don't feel like the entrance exam

source: あなたを見つけようとして 気が気じゃなかったのよ
references: ["I've been out of my mind trying to find you."]
hypothesis: I tried to find you, and I didn't feel like it

source: どんだけぶっ飛ばされれば 気が済むって言うの？ さらにレベルアップして見ようか
references: ["How many of these guys' butts do we have to kick?"]
hypothesis: How many times do you want to be blown away before you're satisfied? Would you like to level up further?

source: 骨が砕ける音がしたぞ　ディアズ もうやめろ　気が済んだだろ
references: ["You hear the bones cracking, Diaz. Come on, that's enough."]
hypothesis: I heard bones crunching.

source: 小屋を調べれば 気が済むだろう
references: ['Maybe we ought to check the shed just to quiet him down.']
hypothesis: If you search the hut, you'll be fine.

source: いや　何も掛かってないと 気が滅入るだけだ
references: ['There are few things more depressing than empty coat hangers.']
hypothesis: No, it's just depressing if it's not hanging

source: まあまあだ 家にいても 気が滅入るだけだし
references: ["After a certain point, time off doesn't help so I figured I'd rather be here."]
hypothesis: It's okay, even if I'm at home, it's just depressing.

source: 気が滅入った時に 探索してたの
references: ['Sometimes I get a little stir-crazy and go exploring.']
hypothesis: I was exploring when I was down

source: 気が短いのはよすのだぞ？
references: ['That temper of yours is a dangerous thing.']
hypothesis: Is it okay to be short-tempered?

source: いい人だけど気が短いわ
references: ["Baby, you're sweet, but you've gotta mellow out."]
hypothesis: I'm a nice person, but I have a short temper.

source: 雇い主は気が短いんだ こいつを使え
references: ['My client is getting impatient. Take these.']
hypothesis: Employers are impatient, use this guy

source: あなたは今気が立ってるだけよ
references: ["You're just a passing phase."]
hypothesis: you're just on your mind

source: 気が立ってたよね
references: ['He seems pretty pissed.']
hypothesis: you were upset

source: 気が立っているんだ そうさ
references: ['It can happen.']
hypothesis: I'm upset, yeah

source: 気が紛れてる。
references: ["I'm distracted."]
hypothesis: I'm lost.

source: 死後があるから― エリーゼが死んでも 気が紛れる
references: ["You think all the ghosts we've seen would somehow make me feel better that Elise is gone."]
hypothesis: Because there's life after death-Even if Elise dies, it's distracting

source: 気が紛れるわよ
references: ['Helps take the edge off.']
hypothesis: I'm losing my mind

source: 私はただ気が緩んでいるだけだった
references: ["I just wasn't paying attention."]
hypothesis: i was just loose

source: つい気が緩んで
references: ["I'm not very focused tonight."]
hypothesis: I feel relaxed

source: 当然だな　気が若いから
references: ["Well, that's not surprising. I was always young at heart, you know."]
hypothesis: Of course I'm young

source: 気が触れぬのは幸運だ
references: ['It is mere luck we are not all insane.']
hypothesis: Lucky to be mad

source: 気が触れた人間の集まりだろうかと
references: ["You think we're crazy."]
hypothesis: I wondered if it was a group of people who were touched

source: 気が触れたか？
references: ['Not yet. Are you crazy?']
hypothesis: Are you offended?

source: 老人を痛めつけるのは気が進まなかったので 打ちのめすのは留まったのさ
references: ["I could've beaten him, but I didn't want to hurt the old man."]
hypothesis: I didn't feel comfortable hurting the old man, so I stopped beating him.

source: ソファで寝ないと 気が重いわ
references: ["Please, Lucas, let me sleep on the couch. I'll feel bad."]
hypothesis: I feel heavy if I don't sleep on the sofa

source: 気が重い
references: ["No, you're not right."]
hypothesis: Feel heavy

source: 仕方ないじゃない　無理して病気が 重くなったら困るでしょ。
references: ["There's nothing we can do. You don't want her to get worse, do you?"]
hypothesis: It can't be helped. If you force yourself to get sick, you'll be in trouble.

source: タイタスが　じきここに来る やつが俺ほど 気が長くないのは知ってるよな
references: ["Well, Titus is gonna be here soon, and we both know that he's not gonna be as patient as I am."]
hypothesis: Titus will be here soon, you know he's not as patient as I am.

source: いいんだ 気にするな
references: ['No worries. No worries.']
hypothesis: don't worry about it

source: また衣装か　そんなの 誰も気にしないってばよ
references: ["Again with the costumes. No one cares what we're wearing."]
hypothesis: Another costume or something like that, no one cares

source: お前がこの事を、、気にする必要はないよ.
references: ['Never mind that. You heard the man. Come on.']
hypothesis: You don't have to worry about this.

source: 気にしないわ・・・いい気味よ
references: ["I don't care. It's what he deserves."]
hypothesis: i don't care...i feel good

source: いや　気にしないで　飲ませて お世話になったんだから
references: ["N-No, it's okay. I can drink. It's a thing about me."]
hypothesis: No, don't worry about it.

source: 斜面は小さくなるが 牛は気にしない
references: ["The chute gets smaller, but the cattle won't mind."]
hypothesis: The slope gets smaller, but the cows don't mind

source: 息を潜めて... 仮面の裏側は気にすることもない.

hypothesis: Hold your breath... don't worry about what's behind the mask.

source: ノートパソコンを渡せ どうやって手に入れたかは　気にしない
references: ["Just give me the laptop. How it got there, I don't really care."]
hypothesis: Give me your laptop, I don't care how you got it

source: 人間の手に渡ったところで、 「ソー」は気にしそうに無いですけど。
references: ["Wouldn't mind getting my human hands on Thor."]
hypothesis: Even if it falls into the hands of humans, "Thor" doesn't seem to care.

source: 気にするな ４年間休暇を取ってないんだ
references: ["Who cares? He hasn't taken a vacation in four years..."]
hypothesis: Don't worry, I haven't taken a vacation in four years.

source: 君が気にしているのに ふと気が付いてね
references: ["I've noticed how you stroke it."]
hypothesis: Even though you care about me, I suddenly realized

source: 彼が死んだことは　気にしてないけど 殺されたことは　気になってるね
references: ["And you don't care that he's dead, but you do care that he was murdered."]
hypothesis: You don't care that he died, but you do care that he was killed.

source: （ｱﾙﾏﾝ）別に もし本当に １週間とか経って気になったら 俺のこと気にしないで ドンドン バンバン...
references: ["If you're still interested in her after a week, don't worry about me."]
hypothesis: (Alman) Anyway, if you really feel like it's been a week, don't worry about me, bang bang...

source: "費用は気にせず 知恵を絞り"

source: 数人の脱走兵が 顔を見せる勇気もなく 湿地に隠れてることは 気にしてない
references: ["Well, I'm not gonna concern myself with five or six deserters hiding' out in the swamp who don't have the courage to show their face."]
hypothesis: I don't mind a few deserters hiding in the swamp without the courage to show their faces.

source: お前は幽霊だから、 首の骨を折っても、気にしないだろう
references: ["Since you're a ghost, you won't mind if I break your neck."]
hypothesis: You're a ghost, so you wouldn't mind if I broke your neck

source: 一つでも汚点を作れば すぐに出向だ お前みたいに なりたくもない病気になっても 周りのやつらから
references: ["you get transferred out immediately. there isn't a single word of apology from those guys around you. they hand you a one way ticket to no man's land."]
hypothesis: If I make even one blemish, I'll be seconded right away Even if I get sick, I don't want to be like you

source: 関係を持つなら 本気にならないと
references: ['If we do this we really did this.']
hypothesis: If you want to have a relationship, you have to be serious

source: ちょっと気になって→
references: ['It bothered me a little so']
hypothesis: I'm a little worried →

source: え？ レイチェルとつき合えて いい気になってるんじゃない？
references: ['Greg, you hung out with Rachel once.']
hypothesis: picture? You're in the mood to hang out with Rachel, aren't you?

source: いい気になるな
references: ["Don't let it go to your head."]
hypothesis: don't feel good

source: 《フッ｡ なんて いい気になってるのかな？
references: ['As if. Am I getting ahead of myself?']
hypothesis: 《Huh. How are you feeling?

source: その気になっても子供たちのせいで、 やる気を失うそうよ。
references: ['She said they were up all night, they were both exhausted all the time, the kids just took every sexual impulse they had outta them.']
hypothesis: Even if they feel like it, they lose their motivation because of the children.

source: 皆病気になり暴力的になる
references: ["People are gettin' sick, they get sick and they get violent."]
hypothesis: everyone gets sick and violent

source: 銀行を目の敵にしてるってわけか しかし気にならないか？
references: ["huh? But isn't it odd?"]
hypothesis: You're blaming the bank, but you don't care?

source: 少ししてから 目を覚ますと 少し狂気になり 非常に暴力的になっていて
references: ['And when you wake up a little bit later, you are a little crazed and very violent.']
hypothesis: A little while later, I woke up a little bit insane and very violent.

source: 格好いいと思います 気に入りました
references: ["I think it's bad-ass. I like it."]
hypothesis: i think it looks cool i like it

source: 俺を睨み付けて 返事が気に入らなければ 俺を壁に叩きつけるんだな
references: ["You get in my face,tighten your jaw,then if I say something you don't like, you slam me against the wall."]
hypothesis: Stare at me, if you don't like my answer, you slam me against the wall

source: 恐らく お前の若い魔女娘は 奴を次第に 気に入ったのだろう
references: ['Maybe your young witch has grown partial to his company.']
hypothesis: Perhaps your young witch girl has grown fond of him.

source: 色々気に入ってる 肉も手に入るし 他のだって
references: ['I like the variety and availability of meats and other goodies...']
hypothesis: I like a lot of things, you can get meat, and others

source: うちの社長は 気に入らない仕事だからって 手を抜くような人じゃ ないですよね？
references: ["Our boss isn't someone who wouldn't do her best just because she doesn't like the product."]
hypothesis: Our president isn't the kind of person who cuts corners just because he doesn't like his job, right?

source: あなたの手段を選ばないところ 気に入っている
references: ['I like this "by-any-means" approach of yours.']
hypothesis: I like that you don't choose your means

source: 少し気に掛かるだろう 爆弾は作動してる

hypothesis: It's a little disturbing, the bomb's working.

source: この余白が気に掛かる
references: ['I hate this margin.']
hypothesis: I'm worried about this margin

source: 聞くことで 気に掛けてくれるとの 貴方への満足感を 与えたく無かった

hypothesis: I didn't want to give you the satisfaction that you care by listening.

source: お気に 掛けないで下さいね ハンサムな方と話が出来るだけでも もう嬉しくて
references: ["I hope you don't mind, but I don't get many handsome young men visitors anymore."]
hypothesis: Please don't worry about me I'm already happy just to be able to talk to a handsome man

source: それで今日　彼女を救う あなたは手伝う事になる たとえあなたが 誰も気に掛けないとしても あなたの娘ジュリアでさえ
references: ["So today, I'm saving hers, and you're gonna help, even if you care about no one, not even your daughter Julia."]
hypothesis: So save her today, you're going to help, even if you don't care about anyone, even your daughter Julia.

source: 俺が目に付くのは 両方を気に掛ける誰かだ 苦難の連続だった
references: ['What I see is somebody that both of us care for having a rough go of it.']
hypothesis: All I see is someone who cares about both It's been a series of hardships

source: - おやおや もう気に病まなくても いいですよ
references: ["You don't need to worry about me anymore."]
hypothesis: - Oh my goodness You don't have to worry anymore

source: 君は気に病むたちだからな もう忘れろ
references: ['Well, you always worried too much, Jim. The past is the past, my friend.']
hypothesis: Forget it

source: 気に病む事はない
references: ["I wouldn't bother, laddie."]
hypothesis: don't worry

source: 先に使ってしまって お気に障ったかしら
references: ["I hope you don't mind that I tried it first."]
hypothesis: I wonder if I used it first

source: 気に障ったかな？
references: ['Mind if I sit?']
hypothesis: Are you upset?

source: 何が気に障った? ん? 最後ぐらい一
references: ['At least die like a honourable man.']
hypothesis: What bothered you?

source: １回は"イエス"の意味だ 気に食わないとさ
references: ["One ding. That means yes. Tio don't like you."]
hypothesis: One time means "yes", if you don't like it

source: 破られたのが 気に食わないんだ
references: ["- I don't think you like the fact that I beat your test."]
hypothesis: I don't like being torn

source: 僕が吹っ切れてるのが 気に食わないんだ
references: ["She just can't stand that I got over it."]
hypothesis: I don't like the fact that I'm blown away

source: ちょっとした 協定が気に食わない・・ 毎月第2週目の火曜・・
references: ["I'd hate for our little arrangement, every second Tuesday of the month..."]
hypothesis: I don't like small agreements... the second Tuesday of every month...

source: 同性愛って... 病気のようなもので 病気は心配です
references: ["Homosexuality is like... is like disease, and I'm afraid of disease."]
hypothesis: Homosexuality is like a disease, and I worry about the disease.

source: 「特に気を付けて頂きたいのは 交換した鍵が漏洩したり」
references: ['"I would like to confirm out of email that the keys we exchanged']
hypothesis: "I want you to be especially careful about leaking the exchanged keys."

source: - 了解 気を付けろ
references: ['I know you know.']
hypothesis: - ok watch out

source: 「足が速いから気を付けろ」と 父に言われたが
references: ["Our dad had warned us how fast that dog was, but we couldn't resist."]
hypothesis: My father told me to be careful because my feet are fast

source: 気を使うな
references: ["Don't mind me."]
hypothesis: don't worry

source: あー 本当はいろいろ進んでんのに （勇気）うん 知らないふりして 気を使って
references: ["You mean how even though things are progressing between them, we have to pretend we don't know."]
hypothesis: (Courage) Yeah, pretend you don't know, be careful

source: 気を使った言い方してくれても いいんじゃない？
references: ['Er, yeah, nicely put, John.']
hypothesis: Wouldn't it be nice if you said it in a polite way?

source: よく判らない グリムに戻らないでいる為に ジュリエットや皆に 何かにつけ 気を使わせたくない
references: ["You know, I just don't want Juliette to constantly have to worry about something bad happening to me, or to her, or to one of our friends."]
hypothesis: I don't know, I don't want to make Juliet and everyone else care about anything, just to keep it from going back to the Grimm.

source: キミは僕の手を煩わせないように気を使うだろ？
references: ['Just try and do your best To keep your hands off me, yeah?']
hypothesis: You take care not to bother me, right?

source: 気を付け そして 互いに気を使い続ける様に
references: ['Be safe out there, look out for each other and keep charging.']
hypothesis: Take care and keep taking care of each other

source: 気を利かせてくれて... ありがとう
references: ['Thank you for your... efficiency.']
hypothesis: Thank you for caring...

source: 気を取り直して働け
references: ['Now pull the cobwebs out of your ass and move.']

references: ["Boy, you sure know how to pick 'em."]
hypothesis: your eyes are tall

source: 目と鼻の先で暴動になったら
references: ['What if we set your backyard on fire?']
hypothesis: If there's a riot right in front of your eyes

source: そんなところの目と鼻の先で働いているんだ
references: ["I can't believe you work right across the street from there."]
hypothesis: I'm working right in front of my eyes

source: 怒りは人を盲目にする... 関わらないのが最良だが
references: ['When fighting angry, blind men... best we just stay out of the way.']
hypothesis: Anger blinds people... but it's best not to get involved

source: 想像できるだろ 家柄も何もない子供が 伝説の人物たちを目にするんだ
references: ['You can imagine what it was like for me, a boy from nowhere, with nothing to his name, watching these legendary men, tilting at the lists.']
hypothesis: You can imagine a kid with no pedigree seeing legends

source: アーノルドは 息子の誕生日を目にしーー そして　この世を去るのを 目にした
references: ['Arnold had watched his son come into this world, and then he had watched that light extinguished.']
hypothesis: Arnold saw his son's birthday--and saw him leave this world.

source: 自分の目を疑う光景を目にすることだろう
references: ['You will see things that will make you doubt your eyes.']
hypothesis: You'll see sights that make you doubt your own eyes

source: 耳にしたことは まったくないわけでもない 目にしたこともまったくないわけじゃない ごめん
references: ["I can't unhear things I've heard, unsee things I've seen."]
hypothesis: It's not that I've never heard of it, it's not that I've never seen it, sorry

source: "ニック 目には目を 歯には歯をだろ？" あれで
references: ['I think the time for being careful is over, Nick.']
hypothesis: "Nick, an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth, right?"

source: いや、ただ中で目に付いて、思ったんだ ほら、持っておくべきだって
references: ['No, I just saw it inside and thought I, you know, should bring it along with me.']
hypothesis: No, I just saw it in the middle and thought, look, I should have it

source: ロビー・ボーイは全く目に付かず かつ何時でも見つけられなければならない
references: ["A Lobby Boy's completely invisible, yet always in sight."]
hypothesis: Lobby boys must be completely invisible and always spotted

source: どうしても目に付く 医者にも行かないのか 私が勧めた
references: ["But I can't help noticing that you are nowhere near the doctor that I recommended."]
hypothesis: Why don't you go to the doctor?

source: わしの価値以上に─ 態度が目に余って 辞めるべきなら...
references: ['If I should cease to be useful, if my behaviors are outweighing my value, well...']
hypothesis: More than I'm worth— If you should quit because of your attitude...

source: 目に余るほどの虚偽 これまでに見た事がない
references: ["A sorrier pack of deck wallopers I don't think I've ever seen."]
hypothesis: A blatant lie I've never seen before

source: 勤務中この二人が目に入っても、
references: ["From time to time, you're gonna see these two."]
hypothesis: Even if I see these two at work,

source: その目に映るもの全て
references: ['All the things I see in your eyes.']
hypothesis: everything you see

source: 君の目に映っているのは 本当の僕じゃない

hypothesis: What you see is not the real me

source: 寝入る姿が目に浮かぶ

hypothesis: I can see myself falling asleep

source: 目に浮かぶよ 巨大なネオンに君の名
references: ['- Straight to the top. Why, I can see your name in lights, lights six feet high.']
hypothesis: I can see your name in the huge neon

source: まざまざと目に浮かぶね

hypothesis: I can see many things in my eyes

source: 見てしまったら 目に焼き付いて離れない

hypothesis: If you see it, it will be burned into your eyes and won't leave

source: この犯人も目に焼き付かれて いる様ですね
references: ['It seems this Ouroboros killer was also obsessed with eyes.']
hypothesis: It seems that this criminal is also burned into his eyes.

source: 目に焼き付いてます
references: ["It's so clear in my mind."]
hypothesis: It's burned into my eyes

source: 目に物見せるわ
references: ['Show me something.']
hypothesis: I'll show you

source: 目に物見せてやる！
references: ["I'll show you what I've got! This!"]
hypothesis: I'll show you!

source: 何か これっていう目標がさ 目に見えてあって 入ってきたわけじゃないから

hypothesis: It's not like I came in because there was some sort of goal in sight

source: ひざに座らされた子供達が 身もだえするのは目に見えてる
references: ["Kids are squirming in his lap all day. It's bound to happen sooner or later."]
hypothesis: I can see the writhing children sitting on my lap

source: 死体を目に触れやすい屋外に捨てるのは ギャングの仕業らしい気もします

hypothesis: I feel like it's the work of a gang to throw a corpse out in the open where it's easy to see.

source: 死体写真を 持ってても デクスタの机でやれば ハリソンの 目に触れない
references: ["And maybe you could keep the photos on Dexter's desk, so Harrison won't see them."]
hypothesis: Even if you have a corpse picture, if you do it at Dexta's desk, Harrison won't see it.

source: 仰々しい演出だ 目に触れるよう 人や物を引用している
references: ["It's a theatrical term referring to a picturesque grouping of people or objects."]
hypothesis: It's an exaggerated production, citing people and things in a way that catches the eye.

source: 目の前が真っ暗になったとき
references: ['And just as everything was going dark,']
hypothesis: when it's dark in front of you

source: 密売人や臓器カルテルにとって 私は目の敵です
references: ['Traffickers, cartels.']
hypothesis: I'm an enemy to traffickers and organ cartels.

source: 魔法省はなぜ僕を目の敵に？
references: ["I don't understand. What has the Ministry of Magic got against me?"]
hypothesis: Why does the Ministry of Magic hate me?

source: おれを目の敵だ
references: ["He was just tryin' to bait me."]
hypothesis: I'm your enemy

source: 何で哀れなスメアゴルを 目の敵にする？
references: ['Why does he hates poor Sméagol?']
hypothesis: What makes poor Smeagol your enemy?

source: 山口の一件で花岡先生を 目の敵にしてるんですよ （蒲生） 裁判所の呼び出しに　応じない場合
references: ['Kuryu has been targeting him ever since Yamaguchi!']
hypothesis: Mr. Hanaoka is an enemy in the Yamaguchi case. (Gamou) If you do not respond to the court summons.

source: 何ヶ月も彼を目の敵にしてきたと言っている
references: ['Monroe and Clennon had it in for him for months.']
hypothesis: Says he's been eyeing him for months

source: - 目の毒だな
references: ["- Well, you shouldn't look like that."]
hypothesis: - Eye poison

source: 目も当てられない
references: ['This looks terrible.']
hypothesis: I can't even look

source: マーシーに関わると 皆 目を付けられる
references: ['Because anybody associated with Marshy is a marked man.']
hypothesis: When you're involved with Mercy, everyone's eyes are on you.

source: 祈りなさい 目を付けられたぞ　アーサー
references: ["Pray on it. Hello. They're on to you, Arthur."]
hypothesis: pray you've been spotted arthur

source: ♪人を傷つける事に目を伏せるけど
references: ['"Tolerance to do harm to others"']
hypothesis: ♪I've been waiting for a while

source: もし、マホーンがそこにいったら、 これ以上目を伏せることができない
references: ["What if he's in there? I can't keep avoiding him."]
hypothesis: If Mahone gets there, I can't keep my eyes down any longer.

source: 両親の話をする度に 目を伏せる
references: ['Every time I mention my parents, your eyes go down.']
hypothesis: Look down every time you talk about your parents

source: 目を凝らすと 今までの人生が見える
references: ['If you look hard enough, you can see your whole life from up here.']
hypothesis: If you look closely, you can see your life up until now

source: 貴方は目を凝らして 耳を澄まして 王子との契約期間を過ごすだけ

hypothesis: All you have to do is keep your eyes open and your ears open for the duration of your contract with the prince.

source: 遠くに目を凝らしても かすんで消えていく
references: ['♪ And when you look too far away ♪ It all but disappears']
hypothesis: Even if I strain my eyes into the distance, it fades and disappears

source: カーターに電話した時に お前は一線を超えた デビッドソンの殺人で 私に目を向けさせようとした

hypothesis: When you called Carter, you crossed the line and tried to point me to Davidson's murder.

source: ゲームに目を向けながら. . 老人の複雑な心境で
references: ['Making the tour of the prison before he left and looking on at a game of skittles with the mixed feelings of an old inhabitant who had his private reasons for believing that it might be his destiny to come back again."']
hypothesis: While looking at the game... with the mixed feelings of an old man

source: まぁ 今は君達２人に 疑いの目を向けている

hypothesis: Well, now I'm looking at you two with suspicion.

source: 真実に目を向けるために 目を開かせるのだ

hypothesis: Open your eyes to face the truth

source: コサックは目を塞がれてきた その結果彼らの大部分は 俺達に反対している
references: ["If we don't arrest the most active enemies now, they'll rebel again."]
hypothesis: The Cossacks have been blinded so that most of them are against us

source: すぐに、君の目を奪う 盲目の女が地下で 生存することは出来ない
references: ['We take your eyes now... and see how long a blind girl can survive in the basement.']
hypothesis: I'll take your eyes off you soon Blind women can't survive underground

source: 部門の防犯カメラの の映像を引き出した メタモルフ薬品のバンが 私の目を引いた

hypothesis: A metamorph drug van caught my eye, pulling footage from the department's security cameras.

source: 警官殺しは　とても注目を引く クーパーが不正をしたことに
references: ['The murder of a cop draws a lot of heat, so dirtying Cooper up is one way to deflect it.']
hypothesis: Killing a cop gets a lot of attention because Cooper cheated.

source: それで絵の構成に 彼を中心に据え 見る人の目を 引きたいと思っています
references: ["So just like this spider, I built my web, hoping to catch the viewer's eye."]
hypothesis: So I want to put him at the center of the composition of my paintings and try to catch the eye of the viewer.

source: ♪人目を引いて 注目を浴びるの
references: ["# I'm gonna make a scene I'm gonna make a fuss"]
hypothesis: ♪It's been a long time

source: お前に目を掛けている
references: ['He cares about you.']
hypothesis: i'm looking at you

source: 私、私の目を欺くか？
references: ['Do my eyes deceive me?']
hypothesis: Am I deceiving my eyes?

source: 俺の目を欺くことは出来ないぞ お前が化けても

source: びっくり仰天 わが目を疑う出し物

hypothesis: Surprise and astonishment, a performance that makes you doubt your eyes

source: - いや、もう自分の目を疑ったよね。

hypothesis: - No, you can't believe your eyes.

source: 目を疑いたくなるような 不可解なものを
references: ["I mean, hell, half the stuff, we wouldn't have believed it ourselves had we not seen it together."]
hypothesis: A mysterious thing that makes you want to doubt your eyes

source: 僕の目を盗んでは 古い地図に見入ってる

hypothesis: Stealing my eyes, staring at old maps

source: 君のママがその指を見て 手を洗いなさいって言うけど それでもママの目を盗んで その指舐めたりしてさ

hypothesis: Your mama looks at those fingers and tells you to wash your hands, but you steal my eyes and lick your fingers

source: 下女ごときが　人目を盗んで

hypothesis: To escape the guilt, turn away from it

hypothesis: don't look away

hypothesis: Cover your eyes, Nancy, I don't want you to see

hypothesis: Cover your eyes ♪ welcome to the machine ♪ ♪ where have you been ♪

source: 目を覆っても 見えるって分かる?

hypothesis: Do you know that you can see even if you cover your eyes?

hypothesis: I'm having you write an autobiography, and this is a spectacular achievement.

source: 目を見張った！
references: ['It is spectacular!']
hypothesis: Eye-opening!

source: 目を見張る忍耐力だ

references: ['Boo wakes up, you fucking sit up with him.']
hypothesis: If you open boo you fucking wake up sitting with him.

source: グレゴリーが目を覚ました 話がしたいって

hypothesis: Gregory woke up and wanted to talk.

source: - これに目を通したら、
references: ['- Look through that,']
hypothesis: - If you look through this,

source: 目を通して　たのむよ
references: ["Come on, you'll see. Please."]
hypothesis: I hope through your eyes

hypothesis: "We read all the reports and hammered them into our heads."

source: - 目を逸らすな
references: ["- Don't look away."]
hypothesis: - Don't look away

source: 目を逸らさなかった。

hypothesis: I didn't look away.

hypothesis: But now I have a choice to turn a blind eye to someone's death or settle it.

source: 盗みに目を配らなきゃならないけどね

hypothesis: I have to keep an eye on stealing

references: ["When I'm out with Daryl, help Hershel keep an eye on things around here."]
hypothesis: I'm going out with Daryl, so keep an eye out for Hershel and the others.

source: 目を開かせるのです 足ではなく・・

source: 遅かれ早かれ目を開くわ

hypothesis: I'll open my eyes sooner or later

source: おい　お前もだ 目を離すな

source: 私はスターラボが地域・社会のために、何が出来るか考えていた。 多分、もう人々はDr. ウェルズに対して それほど目くじらを立てていないだろう。
references: ["I thought if Star Labs could do something nice for the community, maybe people wouldn't be so angry at Doctor Wells anymore."]
hypothesis: I was thinking about what Star Labs could do for the community and society. Maybe people aren't so upset with Dr. Wells anymore.

source: - なんで、そんなに目くじらを立てる
references: ['Do you understand that?']
hypothesis: - Why are you so frustrated?

source: 実に目先が利くな
references: ['Astute, actually.']
hypothesis: really sharp

source: 目先を変えて お互いに親切にしても 良かったかもね
references: ['Maybe we could be kind to one another for a change, huh?']
hypothesis: Maybe we could turn around and be nice to each other

source: 選挙のことから 少し目先を変えて― かぼちゃ大王の話をします

hypothesis: Let's change the subject a little bit from the election, and let's talk about the Great Pumpkin.

source: どうして黙って目先を変えないの？
references: ["Why don't you just shut up for a change?"]
hypothesis: Why don't you shut up and change your eyes?

source: 目処が付くまで捜査する 私が疑われる つまり私達全員が

hypothesis: Investigate until I have a clue, I'm suspected, I mean all of us

source: ナンシー パリで目星を付けた女
references: ['Nancy, okay, you know the woman I spotted in Paris, the bomber?']
hypothesis: Nancy Paris

source: 目玉が飛び出るほど高かったけど 18の誕生日だったから...
references: ['It was outrageously expensive, but it was her 18th birthday, so...']
hypothesis: It was eye-poppingly expensive, but it was my 18th birthday...

source: なるほど ったく相変わらず頑固だな

references: ['As usual, your power grabs are more important than rescuing your brother.']
hypothesis: As usual, it's more important for you to seize power than to rescue your brother.

source: でも彼は相変わらず 時計のネジを巻き続けている
references: ["But there's you every day winding that stupid watch."]
hypothesis: But he still winds the clock screw

source: 相変わらず口が悪くて よかった
references: ["I'm glad to see you still have your twisted sense of humor."]
hypothesis: I'm glad I still have a bad mouth

source: 僕らの血液の相性が悪いと 君は死ぬことになる
references: ['If our blood is incompatible, you could die.']
hypothesis: If our blood isn't compatible, you'll die.

source: 相性が悪いと言われて... 里親にね。
references: ["- Said I wasn't a good fit."]
hypothesis: I was told I wasn't compatible... with my foster parents.

source: - 中佐、ウィルスは炭素ベースの生命体とは相性が悪いんです
references: ['Commander, the virus is incompatible with carbon-based life.']
hypothesis: - Lieutenant Colonel, viruses don't mix well with carbon-based life forms.

source: そりゃ　相談に乗ってもらったり 力を借りることはあるけど→ できる限り　自分でやらなきゃって 思ってるの。
references: ['That is, by consulting with you, I enlist your help but as much as I can, I believe I must do it myself.']
hypothesis: Well, there are times when I ask for advice and borrow strength, but I think I have to do it myself as much as possible.

source: あの　ドレスについて相談に 乗ってくれるって言ってたわよね
references: ['Hey, you said you wanted to help me with my dress.']
hypothesis: You said you'd come and talk to me about that dress, didn't you?

source: 相談に乗ると電話番号を俺に
references: ['Why you slipped me your number in case I ever need to ask anything?']
hypothesis: Give me your phone number when you talk to me

source: あの人ったら 固まって眉一つ動かさないの
references: ["He didn't dare raise an eyebrow."]
hypothesis: That person freezes and doesn't move an eyebrow

source: 真に受けていない
references: ["Don't be an ass."]
hypothesis: not taken seriously

source: あの女の言うことなど 真に受けるな
references: ["Oh, for christ's sake. How many times I got to tell you, that woman is crazy, Larry."]
hypothesis: Don't take what that woman says seriously

source: 奴らの言うことを 真に受けちゃだめだ... 地獄みてぇに 狂わされるからな
references: ['They say they try to get you straight... but they make you crazier than hell.']
hypothesis: Don't take what they say seriously...it will drive you crazy like hell

source: そうさ... 教皇の話は 真に迫る
references: ['Yeah, well, the Pope tells it like it really is.']
hypothesis: Yes... The Pope's story is so true

source: そして　完全な被害者だ 私　真に迫っていたわよね？
references: ["I was so believable today, wasn't I?"]
hypothesis: And I'm the perfect victim.

source: それは真っ赤な嘘だった
references: ['It was a big lie.']
hypothesis: it was a blatant lie

source: 入局して 真っ赤な嘘だと分かったよ
references: ['I wish someone had told me it is a total lie.']
hypothesis: When I joined the station, I found out that it was a complete lie

source: それは真っ赤な嘘だ
references: ['That is an outright lie.']

hypothesis: Kevin, you've heard a lot of stories - you've read a lot of bullshit about me.

source: さて　此奴の事を何か 耳にしたら

hypothesis: Well, if you hear anything about this guy

hypothesis: Then I won't be able to tell you a very funny little gossip that I stumbled upon.

hypothesis: My lord, if I have heard of you at all-

references: ['When you say it like that, I become deaf to any good parts of your story.']
hypothesis: Because I say it myself, good stories don't come to my ears

hypothesis: What do I mean, you had better hear that Claire Williams was okay.

hypothesis: One thing I want to keep in mind

hypothesis: Stoic Now, some people overheard me, "Do you have a plan?"

hypothesis: But I overheard that he's the trigger, you say you're the best

hypothesis: All you've said and all I've heard is that you're dead

hypothesis: It's a song that sticks in your ears

references: ['He listens to Al Haymon.']
hypothesis: Sam Watson Haymon Boxing Sam Watson Haymon Boxing Listening to Haymon and consulting with him

hypothesis: I'm glad I listened to you

hypothesis: they were skeptical as well

hypothesis: - don't listen

hypothesis: (Babazono) That's right.

hypothesis: you have a heart

hypothesis: Chilled my liver!

hypothesis: take to heart

hypothesis: remember

references: ['I gotta work on that.']

hypothesis: It's the crest of the pike. On that day, we fought shoulder to shoulder.

hypothesis: But doesn't your chest hurt?

hypothesis: How excited I am about what you brought

references: ['But there was someone black-hearted.']

references: ['With all due respect, this is not the time or the place to share the details.']
hypothesis: I'm sorry for repeating myself, but now is not the time or place to give you detailed information.

source: 協力する限り、俺は話が分かる男だ、 一言聞くぜ、リック。
references: ["I'm a very reasonable man as long as you cooperate, so let me ask you a question, Rick."]
hypothesis: As long as I cooperate, I'm a man who knows what I'm talking about, listen to me, Rick.

source: 救世主は話が分かるんだ。
references: ['Saviors can actually be quite reasonable.']
hypothesis: The Savior knows what he's talking about.

source: それとこれとは話が違う
references: ["Look, you can't be doing this right now."]
hypothesis: And this is a different story

source: 調子に乗りすぎたよ この年頃の小さな子供ってこうだろう
references: ["I shouldn't have encouraged her, but you know what little children are like these days."]
hypothesis: I got too carried away I guess this is what a small child of this age is like

source: このやり方は諸刃の剣だぞ
references: ['This little game cuts both ways.']
hypothesis: This method is a double-edged sword

source: だが、豹変するだろう
references: ['You wait till it turns ugly.']
hypothesis: but it will change

source: 赤くなっちゃった このワインのせいね
references: ["I'm flushed. Must be the wine."]
hypothesis: It's because of this wine that turned red

source: 赤くなった
references: ['Are you blushing?']
hypothesis: turned red

source: ＜新しい ショコラティエが オープンして 足を運ばないわけがない＞
references: ["If a new chocolatier opens up, there's no way she won't stop by."]
hypothesis: <There is no reason not to visit a new chocolatier when it opens>

source: 俺に身を任せろ
references: ['I need you to trust me.']
hypothesis: leave yourself to me

source: この春　自分　身を固めようと思いまして
references: ["My girlfriend and I, we're thinking of settling down."]
hypothesis: I'm thinking of fixing myself this spring

source: 頼む、同じ轍を踏むな、いいな？
references: ["Please, don't go down this road again, ok?"]
hypothesis: Please, don't make the same mistake, okay?

source: 途方に暮れたよ 子連れで文無し 定職もない
references: ["I didn't know how I was going to manage with a small boy, with no money and no regular job."]
hypothesis: I'm at a loss.

source: 光の中　俺のために道が開いている
references: ['I shall revel in that fire! In that fire I shall find my bride!']
hypothesis: in the light there's a way for me

source: いろんな道が開けてきました 両親に教わらなかったことも
references: ["It helped expose me to things that my parents or friends didn't show me."]
hypothesis: Many paths have opened up, things my parents didn't teach me

source: あれほど釘を刺したろ
references: ['You did exactly what I told you not to do!']
hypothesis: You nailed me like that

source: 一度も音を上げなかった
references: ['That not for a single moment did his courage waver.']
hypothesis: never made a sound

source: わかった、じゃあ頭から
references: ['All right. From the top.']
hypothesis: ok, then head on

source: 2003初頭からMIA 戦死者扱いだった だが もう違う
references: ['MIA since early 2003 and presumed dead... until now.']
hypothesis: Since the beginning of 2003, MIA was treated as dead, but that's not the case anymore.

source: ３年生の頭から 監督に謝りに行って
references: ['So at the beginning of my third year... I went and apologized to my coach and asked to start all over again.']
hypothesis: From the beginning of my third year, I went to apologize to the director

source: あなた方　捜査官には 頭が下がるけれど
references: ['The Agency appreciates everything your people are doing.']
hypothesis: I'm humbled by you investigators, but

source: そんなに頭が切れるなら 何故ここに来たの？
references: ["Then why'd you come up here if you're so smart?"]
hypothesis: If you're so smart, why are you here?

source: "私が頭が痛くても" "痛い顔したり" "声 出したり"
references: ['Even if my head hurts, no one knows until I cry.']
hypothesis: "Even if my head hurts" "I make a painful face" "I speak"

source: 頭に入れておきます　ありがとう
references: ['I put it on my to do list ". Thanks.']
hypothesis: i'll keep that in mind thanks

source: 地図は頭に入れておけ
references: ["Next time stay put, you won't need a map."]
hypothesis: keep the map in mind

source: 俺達が頭を下げたのはドラゴンだ そしてドラゴンはもう死んだ！
references: ['It was the Dragons we bowed to and now the Dragons are dead!']
hypothesis: It's the dragon that we bowed to And the dragon is dead!

source: 友よ... 君達は... 誰にも 頭を下げなくていい
references: ['My friends you bow to no one.']
hypothesis: My friend... you guys... don't have to bow your head to anyone

source: 頭を冷やそう　ここじゃ無理だ 名前は？
references: ["Chill out. Can we just talk about this? What's your name?"]
hypothesis: Let's keep our heads down It's impossible here What's your name?

source: 頭を冷やしてくる
references: ['I need some air.']
hypothesis: cool down my head

source: ベイビー　よく顔を見せて
references: ["- Oh my baby! - You're really here. - Let me look at you."]
hypothesis: Baby show me your face

source: 2度と顔を見せるなと言ったのに また帰ってきた こいつと こそこそと...
references: ['I told you never to show your face here again but here you are... snooping around with this...']
hypothesis: I told you not to show me your face again, but you came back with me, stealthily...

source: あいつは食えない奴だ
references: ['Well, george is capable of a lot of things.']
hypothesis: he can't eat

source: 君は本当に食えない女だな
references: ['You are so full of shit, Patty.']
hypothesis: you really can't eat

source: あと 2人の首が 飛ぶのね
references: ['That means two more heads are about to roll.']
hypothesis: 2 more heads will fly

source: 優しいな　どうでもいいが 誰かに首にされたとして
references: ["That's very kind to say. Unless it stopped being a job because someone fired you, in which case..."]
hypothesis: I don't care if someone fires me

source: −君は私を首にする。
references: ['- You are firing me.']
hypothesis: - You fire me.

source: 「仕事を首になって アパートから追い出された」
references: ['"I got fired from my job. I got kicked out of my apartment."']
hypothesis: "I got kicked out of my apartment because I lost my job."

source: お前が首になったのは お前自身のせいだ
references: ["I didn't lose your job for you, Wade, you did that."]
hypothesis: It's your own fault that you got fired

source: 急いだ方が良いぞ 副大統領が皆の首を切ろうとしてる
references: ["And it better be soon, because the Vice President's about to fire us all."]
hypothesis: Better hurry, the vice president is going to decapitate everyone.

source: ところが君は生活の為に オマハで人の首を切りに行った
references: ['Instead you went to Omaha to fire people for a living?']
hypothesis: But you went to Omaha to cut off people's heads for a living.

source: 彼は君を首を長くして待っているぞ
references: ["he's been waiting for you a real long time,man."]
hypothesis: he's waiting for you

source: どこの馬の骨だ バーニー？
references: ['Who is this bimbo, Barney?']
hypothesis: Where's the horse bone, Barney?

source: 何所の馬の骨だ　何の話だ？
references: ["I don't fucking know you. What business?"]
hypothesis: Where are the horse bones from? What are you talking about?

source: お前は馬の骨だった
references: ["I didn't know you at all."]
hypothesis: you were a horse bone

source: 僕の ビジネスパートナーなら 気骨がある所を 見せてみろ！
references: ["If you are to become my business partner, Macduff, you've got to start showing some backbone!"]
hypothesis: If you're my business partner, show me your guts!

source: 彼女は鉄の気骨がある
references: ['That girl has an iron backbone.']
hypothesis: she has an iron grit

source: 取り調べは徹底的で 骨が折れ 退屈な作業だ
references: ['The checking of the suspects had been thorough, painstaking, and tedious.']
hypothesis: The interrogation is exhaustive, laborious and tedious.

source: 強敵を見つけるには 骨が折れるが
references: ['Though, you know, finding a worthy opponent has been a little challenging.']
hypothesis: It takes a lot of effort to find a strong enemy

source: 僕は移住はしない この国に骨を埋める
references: ['No, I reject this idea of abandoning my country.']
hypothesis: I won't emigrate, I'll bury my bones in this country

source: せっかくですが私は この銀行に 骨を埋める所存でおります
references: ['but I intend to stay at this bank for the rest of my career.']
hypothesis: I am willing to bury my bones in this bank.

source: 彼らの為に骨を折った事がある、 法的に言えば、5年の刑のを。
references: ["Oh, I've been pulling their chestnuts out of the fire, legally speaking, for five years."]
hypothesis: I've toiled for them, legally speaking, five years in prison.

source: 君を弁護するとすれば、 君が何も見えない様に私が骨を折ったのだ。
references: ['In your defense, I worked very hard to blind you.']
hypothesis: In your defense, I took it upon myself to keep you from seeing anything.

source: 一つ骨を折ってみよう
references: ['I will see what we can do.']
hypothesis: let's break one bone

source: マスター・スカイウォーカーは鼻が高いでしょう
references: ['Master Skywalker should be proud.']
hypothesis: Master Skywalker will have a high nose

source: フェニックス 灰の中から生まれ変わる不死鳥だ
references: ['Phoenix. Risen from the ashes.']
hypothesis: Phoenix A phoenix reborn from the ashes

source: あんた 人が変わったみたい
references: ['You seem like a changed person.']
hypothesis: You seem to have changed

source: この２人が　悪い奴で
references: ['Yes. Uh, those two are the bad guys.']
hypothesis: These two are bad guys

source: 進歩は始まらないよ 夢の意味を認めらないまま
references: ["You won't make any progress... until you recognize your dreams for what they are."]
hypothesis: Progress won't start without acknowledging the meaning of dreams

source: 考えてみてくれ 長椅子に寝ていても何も始まらない
references: ["I'm not gonna get over anything by just lying on the couch. It's not a good idea."]
hypothesis: Think about it, lying on the couch won't start anything

source: 他の誰かが彼女の手を取っていたらいやだな
references: ["I don't like someone else's hands on my girls."]
hypothesis: I wish someone else took her hand

source: だから、ちょうど私から手を取るのだろうか？
references: ['So will you just take your hands off me?']
hypothesis: So will you just take my hand off me?

source: サー・マンドンは王の旗を掲げろ
references: ["Ser Mandon, you will bear the King's banner."]
hypothesis: Sir Mandon raise the king's banner

source: 休暇を取ったと 聞きましたが
references: ['I was told that she requested emergency leave.']
hypothesis: I heard you took a vacation

source: 何を心配してるの 純資産が　標的になるの？
references: ['What, are you worried that your net worth makes you a target?']
hypothesis: What are you worried about, will your net worth become a target?

source: 世界刑事裁判所の代表として 標的になるのが私の役目だ
references: ['the head of the world criminal court, it would make sense for me to be a target.']
hypothesis: As a representative of the World Criminal Court, it's my job to be the target.

source: 限界を見失う前に 標的になる前に
references: ['Before you lose your edge, before you become a target.']
hypothesis: Before I lose sight of my limits, before I become a target

source: 指が硬くなってる
references: ['From here the tension passes on to your fingers.']
hypothesis: my fingers are getting stiff

source: それ聞いたあと学校に 行く息子の身になってもみろって
references: ['Imagine going to school with that in your head.']
hypothesis: After hearing that, try to put yourself in your son's shoes and go to school.

source: 弁護側は "被告の身になって" と言うでしょう
references: ["The defense would have you walk in his client's shoes."]
hypothesis: The defense will say, "Put yourself in the shoes of the defendant."

source: だから 誰かの 身になって考えるなら どうか グロリアさんの 身になって考えて
references: ["So if you are gonna put yourself in anyone's shoes... put yourself... in Gloria Mitchell's."]
hypothesis: So if you want to put yourself in someone else's shoes, please put yourself in Gloria's shoes.

source: オーディションに落ちたのは 幸いなんだよ パーティーでの演奏なんて 頭が痛いぞ
references: ["Believe me, Marty, you're better off without having to worry about all the aggravation and headaches of playing at that dance."]
hypothesis: I'm lucky that I failed the audition. Playing at a party hurts my head.

source: 最悪の状況で頭が痛いです
references: ["I'm getting a bad feeling about where this is headed."]
hypothesis: I have a headache in the worst situation
